    • getCurrency

      public String getCurrency()
      Gets reference currency used for the refund, usually the same as the currency used to create the invoice.
      Returns:
      the currency

    • setCurrency

      public void setCurrency(String currency)
      Sets reference currency used for the refund, usually the same as the currency used to create the invoice.
      Parameters:
      currency - the currency

    • getAmount

      public Hashtable<String,Double> getAmount()
      Gets amount. For a refunded invoice, this object will contain the crypto currency amount refunded by BitPay to the consumer (in the selected transactionCurrency) and the equivalent refunded amount from the invoice in the given currency (thus linked to the amount debited from the merchant account to cover the refund).
      Returns:
      the amount

    • setAmount

      public void setAmount(Hashtable<String,Double> amounts)
      Sets amount. For a refunded invoice, this object will contain the crypto currency amount refunded by BitPay to the consumer (in the selected transactionCurrency) and the equivalent refunded amount from the invoice in the given currency (thus linked to the amount debited from the merchant account to cover the refund).
      Parameters:
      amounts - the amounts

    • getReference

      public String getReference()
      Gets reference. Present only if specified in the request to create the refund. This is your reference label for this refund. It will be passed-through on each response for you to identify the refund in your system. Maximum string length is 100 characters.
      Returns:
      the reference

    • setReference

      public void setReference(String reference)
      Sets reference. Present only if specified in the request to create the refund. This is your reference label for this refund. It will be passed-through on each response for you to identify the refund in your system. Maximum string length is 100 characters.
      Parameters:
      reference - the reference
